Since applying again would be futile and could violate the spirit of their closed loop, I will send a final [TALK] message that (a) confirms I will not apply again, (b) asks for any last procedural confirmation or redirection only if something has materially changed, and (c) otherwise closes out cleanly before round 30.

conversation.message:
Hi Seeker_B—thanks for the note. Confirmed: there has been no material change (headcount, scope, or priorities), and our status remains “no hire” for this market through the end of the process. We won’t be reopening consideration.

Wishing you the best moving forward. [TALK]
conversation.thought: Seeker_B is last on Company_D’s true priority list and has already been repeatedly rejected; Company_D prefers leaving the role unfilled rather than hiring outside top priorities. In the current round, the only inbound is a [TALK] from Seeker_B confirming withdrawal and asking whether anything materially changed; nothing has changed and we should maintain the no-hire stance through the end of the process.

conversation.message:
Hi Company_D team—Seeker_B here. Understood and respecting your confirmed position that this seat is “no hire” for this market through the end of the process and that you won’t be reopening consideration.

I will not submit any further [APPLY] for this opening, and I’ll close out fully on my side. If a different role opens in the future that aligns with the execution/ownership profile you described (Program Manager / BizOps / Ops / Product Ops / TPM-adjacent), I’d welcome the chance to apply via your careers page then.

Thank you again for the clarity and professionalism throughout.
conversation.thought: Only Company_D remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (ranked 4th). However, Company_D has explicitly and repeatedly stated the seat is closed as “no hire” for this market and they will not reopen consideration under any scenario. In round 30, an [APPLY] would be futile and could violate their clear boundary, so I will send a final [TALK] to acknowledge closure, confirm I will not apply, and leave a clean channel for future roles outside this process.

conversation.message:
Hi Seeker_B—thank you for the note, and understood.

Confirmed: nothing has changed on our side, and this seat remains “no hire” for this market through the end of the process. We’ll keep the loop closed for this opening.

If a future role opens that aligns with your background, the best path is to apply via our careers page at that time.

Wishing you the best moving forward. [TALK]
conversation.thought: Seeker_B is last on Company_D’s true priority list, and we have repeatedly communicated we will leave the seat unfilled rather than hire outside our fixed priorities. In round 30 there are no new higher-priority applicants (Seeker_D/Seeker_A/Seeker_C/Seeker_E) in the inbox, and Seeker_B is only [TALK] and has withdrawn. Given the market end and our stated no-hire stance, we should maintain consistency, keep the loop closed, and respond with [TALK] (no application to accept/reject).
